decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal">The
proposed extensions, by virtue the harm to the special character and appearance of the conservation area and locally listed Pinnerwood Cottage, and setting of the locally listed Pinnerwood Farmhouse and grade II Pinnerwood House, due to the prominent bulky, scale, mass of the large additions to the cottage undermining the characteristic low to medium densities of development and domestic cottage character of the house, loss of architectural coherence in the conservation area, introducing a bulky roof form, and loss of other architectural quality e.g. gable end with neat timber bargeboard. There is not clear and convincing justification for this harm, nor public benefits to outweigh it. As such, it would not preserve the rural character and appearance of the Conservation
Area, interest of the locally listed buildings &amp; special interest of the setting of the Pinnerwood
House Listed Building, contrary to the high-quality design aspirations of the
National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policies D3 and HC1 of The London
Plan (2021), Policies DM1 and DM7 of Harrow’s Development Management Policies
Local Plan document (2013); the relevant provisions of the adopted Harrow
Supplementary Planning Document Residential Design Guide (2010); and Pinnerwood
Farm Conservation Area Appraisal and Management Strategy.<font face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><o:p></o:p></span></font></p>

<p class="MsoNormal">The
proposed development, by reason of its substantially greater massing and consolidated bulky design &amp; form&nbsp;at first floor level, would result in an inappropriate addition that creates a visually more obtrusive
dwelling, to the detriment to the openness
of the Green Belt, contrary to Policies
D3, &amp; G2 of the&nbsp; London Plan (2021), Policies CS1.B &amp; F of the Harrow Core
Strategy (2021); Policies DM1 and DM16 Harrow’s Development Management Policies (2013), and the
National Planning Policy Framework (2023).&nbsp;</p>
description: Single and two storey rear extension; external alterations (demolition of rear extension, double garage, conservatory, side canopy, oil store and removal of swimming pool)
